intro: Vaccinium cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a small, dark blue berry that contains a single seed. Vaccinium cavaleriei thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with high humidity.
